content.prompt: Which of the following best explains a difference in the cabinet between the Nigerian presidential system and the British parliamentary system?

choices.label: Cabinet members are elected in the United Kingdom but not in Nigeria, so policymaking often becomes cumbersome as representatives work hard to represent their constituents rather than the country as a whole.

There are fewer institutional obstacles for cabinets in the United Kingdom than in Nigeria because the executive and legislature are controlled by the same political party, so policymaking may be quicker and more efficient.
In Nigeria cabinet members are appointed by the Supreme Court, and in the United Kingdom cabinet members are chosen by the majority party.
Conservative parties in Nigeria and in the United Kingdom are able to institute policy changes more easily than liberal parties since they are usually more closely affiliated with the monarchy.
